results.title: Solar promise
results.creator_credit: Tom Putnam, Henry Mayer and Bullfrog Films
results.brief_description: Examines the use of solare energy for home heating. Active and passive systems are illustrated and the principles of each are outlined. A variety of homes are shown and the costs, advantages and potential for a wide range of climate conditions are fully covered. Reference is made to the indians of southwest America who understood and used passive solar heating.

results.title: Harmonic motion
results.brief_description: Surveys many timekeeping and other examples of harmonic motion and resonance. Shows how timekeeping let to improvements in our knowledge of harmonic motion. Also notes some mathematical applications.

results.title: Krakanos and the ghost
results.brief_description: A puppet animated film about Krakanos the good hearted king of the mountain who solves the mystery of a money hungry ghost. The ghost has taken to scaring away travellers from the village that is dependent on tourism for a livelihood. Krakanos decides that it is time that he intervened and teaches the ghost a well deserved lesson.

results.title: Footy for kids
results.brief_description: Designed for coaches of junior footballers. Highlights the sequential stages of skill development, the aim of practice sessions for junior players, the format of practice sessions and the principles of skill teaching.

results.title: Girl stuff
results.creator_credit: Barbara Noble, Robert Churchill and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Aimed at adolescent girls this program covers a range of issues regarding female hygiene. Discusses the pros and cons of deodorants, advice about pelvic infections and changes in the reproductive system at puberty.

results.title: The Netherland
results.creator_credit: Bert Haanstra and Bert Haanstra Film Productions
results.brief_description: Directed by internationally known film maker Bert Haanstra, this non narrated impressionistic film looks at various facets of life and landscapes of which the Netherlands is composed. The filmmaker has also cleverly woven into the film structure, several visual deceptions making the film of value to media studies classes.

results.title: Africa: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Wayne Mitchell and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the people and the continent of Africa. Notes the different races of people, their history and social conditions that exist today including the system of apartheid. Also looks at the geography of the continent showing diversity between grasslands, desert and tropical areas. Briefly mentions African problems such as housing and education.

results.title: Bellamy's Daintree: where reef meets rainforest
results.creator_credit: Australian Conservation Foundation and Wilderness Society
results.brief_description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.
results.description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.

results.title: Falstaff
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Roanld Eyre, BBC-TV, Covent Garden Video Productions, Los Angeles Philharmonic Association and Teatro Comunale, Florence
results.brief_description: Falstaff is an opera in three acts by Giuseppe Verdi, with libretto by Arrigo Boito from Shakespeare’s plays, The Merry Wives of Windsor and Henry IV. It was Verdi’s last opera, written at an advanced age, and is noted for its concluding fugue, “Tutto nel mondo e burla” (“All the world’s a joke”). This made for television production was performed at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden by the Royal Opera, directed by Sir John Tooley and featuring the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Carlo Maria Giulini and the Royal Opera Chorus led by Chorus master John McCarthy. Renato Bruson is brilliant in the role of Sir John Falstaff as are the rest of the leading singers including Dalmacio Gonzalez (Fenton), Brenda Boozer (Meg Page), Barbara Hendricks (Nanetta), Lucia Valentini-Terrani (Mistress Quickly), Leo Nucci (Ford) and Katia Ricciarelli (Alice Ford). Realistic stage sets by Hayden Griffin and period costumes by Michael Stennett, along with the wonderful atmosphere of the Royal Opera House, set the mood of the time. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles. Includes booklet with English translation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Large, Roanld Eyre, BBC-TV, Covent Garden Video Productions, Los Angeles Philharmonic Association and Teatro Comunale, Florence

results.title: Forestry as a career
results.creator_credit: Christopher Ross and Dept of Forestry, Australian National University
results.brief_description: The professional management of forests for the multiple benefits of wood production, protection of soil and water quality, conservation of plants, animals and recreation requires four years university study. Depicts the training provided at the Australian National University leading to a degree of BSc (Forestry).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Ross and Dept of Forestry, Australian National University
